Name: Honolulu
Ingredients: 45 ml Light white rum (charcoal-filtered 1-4 years old)
7.5 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
Instructions: Select and pre-chill an Old-fashioned glass .
Prepare garnish of pineapple wedge & Luxardo Maraschino Cherry .
BLEND all ingredients with crushed ice.
Review: Cooling, fruity and pretty light on alcohol - perfect for a hot afternoon in Honolulu.
History: Adapted from a recipe in Victor Bergeron 's 1972 Trader Vic's Bartender's Guide (revised edition) with his TV logo alongside the recipe denoting that this is one of Trader Vic's own creations, confirmed by his writing, " This is one of the first drinks that we ever originated. "
Nutrition: One serving of Honolulu contains 160 calories
